dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5650 IH: To amend the Animal Welfare Act to repeal the extension of the prohibition on animal fighting to the territories.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Moylan introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Animal Welfare Act to repeal the extension of the prohibition on animal fighting to the territories.

section.text: This Act may be cited as The Senator Jose Pedo Terlaje Honoring Indigenous Traditions and Attributes Act or The Senator Jose Pedo Terlaje HITA Act.

section.header: Repeal of extension of the prohibition on animal fighting to the territories

subsection.text: Section 26 of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2156) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking It and inserting Except as provided in paragraph (3), it; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: With respect to fighting ventures involving live birds in a State where it would not be in violation of the law, it shall be unlawful under this subsection for a person to sponsor or exhibit a bird in the fighting venture only if the person knew that any bird in the fighting venture was knowingly bought, sold, delivered, transported, or received in interstate or foreign commerce for the purpose of participation in the fighting venture.
by redesignating subsections (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i) as subsection (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), and (j), respectively; and
by inserting after subsection (c) the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection (c), the activities prohibited by such subsection shall be unlawful with respect to fighting ventures involving live birds only if the fight is to take place in a State where it would be in violation of the laws thereof.

subsection.header: Use of Postal Service or other interstate instrumentalities
subsection.text: Section 26(c) of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2156(c)) is amended by striking (d) and inserting (e).
Subsection (j) of section 26 of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2156), as redesignated, is amended by striking (d) and inserting (e).
Section 49(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking (d) and inserting (e).
